intro: Cybianthus pseudolongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Cybianthus pseudolongifolius thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats.
